content: The MCP process allows for marking an MCP as conditionally accepted. https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/issues/450 seems like a good candidate for that but I can't find information on how to actually mark an MCP as conditionally accepted. Do I just @rustbot second and leave a comment?
just my .2 cents - I can't find a previous MCP that was "conditionally accepted" so I think that seconding + comment will do just fine

I just seconded that MCP and as a consequence it moved to FCP immediately. That does not seem to be quite in line with the description at https://forge.rust-lang.org/compiler/mcp.html#public-facing-changes-require-rfcbot-fcp
I think we'll need some flow charts for the process here :)
If you wanted a team vote/signoff you should have invoked @rfcbot merge directly
I think there have been MCPs that said in the proposal text that the MCP would be discarded if e.g. it would cause perf regressions (not sure though)
